p:
In the Atlantic coast of France, the foraging habitats comprised agricultural landscape, wet meadows, tidal habitats, and saltpans in the period 2000â€“2004, but then the ibises switched to rubbish dumps and freshwater marshes after the arrival of the invasive Red Swamp Crayfish Procambarus clarkii, which is an important element in their diet
60 . This crayfish is widespread in Italy
70, 71 , but is common in rice fields and freshwater wetlands, the currently preferred environments for ibis, thus probably reducing the ability to promote a feeding habitat change in our study area.
